    • Method Detail

      • init

        public int init()
        Init FT_4222_Device class and sync the chip status internally
        Returns:
        FT4222_OK if successful, otherwise the return value is an FT error code.

      • setClock

        public int setClock(byte clk)
        Set the system clock rate. The FT4222H supports 4 clock rates: 80MHz, 60MHz, 48MHz, or 24MHz. By default, the FT4222H runs at 60MHz clock rate.
        Parameters:
        clk - FT4222 system clock rate
        Returns:
        FT4222_OK if successful, otherwise the return value is an FT error code.

      • getClock

        public int getClock(byte[] clk)
        Get the current system clock rate.
        Parameters:
        clk - FT4222 system clock rate
        Returns:
        FT4222_OK if successful, otherwise the return value is an FT error code.

      • cleanRxData

        public boolean cleanRxData()
        Clear inner read buffer
        Returns:
        true if data exists in the read buffer, otherwise return false.

      • isFT4222Device

        public boolean isFT4222Device()
        Check if the device is FT4222 device
        Returns:
        Return true iff the device is a FT4222 device; otherwise return false.

      • getI2cMasterDevice

        public I2cMaster getI2cMasterDevice()
        Get I2c mater interface
        Returns:
        Return a I2C mater interface; return null, if it is not a FT4222 device.

      • getI2cSlaveDevice

        public I2cSlave getI2cSlaveDevice()
        Get I2c slave interface
        Returns:
        Return a I2C slave interface; return null, if it is not a FT4222 device.

      • getSpiMasterDevice

        public SpiMaster getSpiMasterDevice()
        Get Spi mater interface
